sections.TOP:
Whispering Wood070562b24p9l46c4fyfe5z7zc66hd6c5ttmd1759252015-03-09T02:21:29ZThe Dragon Demands5014364[[Image:Whispering Wood.png|thumb|200px|A map showing the location of the Whispering Wood on the continent of Westeros.]]
The '''Whispering Wood''' is a forest in [[the Riverlands]], located northwest of [[Riverrun]] along the [[Trident|Red Fork of the Trident]].<ref name="S2 map">[http://viewers-guide.hbo.com/game-of-thrones/season1/#!/locations/the-whispering-wood/ HBO viewers guide, season 1 map, Whispering Wood entry]</ref>
sections.In the books:
In the ''[[A Song of Ice and Fire]]'' novels the Whispering Wood is northwest of Riverrun.

The first season HBO viewers guide showed the Whispering Wood to the north-west of Riverrun.<ref>[http://viewers-guide.hbo.com/game-of-thrones/season2/#!/locations/the-whispering-wood/ HBO viewers guide, season 2 map, Whispering Wood entry]</ref> The second season map, however, positions it east of [[Seagard]].<ref name="S2 map"/> The initial [[Season 2]] viewer's guide map seems to have been in error, because the HBO Viewer's Guide "Battleground [[Westeros]]" feature released later in Season 2 positioned Whispering Wood as immediately north-west of Riverrun, as in the books.<ref>[http://viewers-guide.hbo.com/game-of-thrones/season2/#!/map/special/battleground-westeros/4/ HBO Season 2 Viewer's Guide, "Battleground Westeros"]</ref>
sections.History:
===[[Season 1]]===
The [[Battle of the Whispering Wood]] occurred here, during which [[Robb Stark]] lured [[Jaime Lannister]]'s army into a trap and annihilated it, capturing the Kingslayer himself, thus lifting Jaime's siege of Riverrun.<ref>"[[Baelor]]".</ref>
